law.catch_line: A risk retention group that seeks to be chartered in the State:...

text.section:
A risk retention group that seeks to be chartered in the State:
shall be chartered and licensed as a liability insurance company in conformance with all insurance laws and regulations of the State; and
except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, shall comply with:
all the laws, regulations, and requirements applicable to insurers chartered and licensed in the State; and
the requirements of § 25-103 of this subtitle, to the extent that those requirements are not a limitation on the laws, regulations, or requirements of the State.

section.section: Before a risk retention group may offer insurance in a state, the risk retention group shall submit a plan of operation or feasibility study to the Commissioner for approval.

Within 10 days of a change to an item of the plan of operation or feasibility study, the risk retention group shall submit to the Commissioner an appropriate revision of the plan of operation or feasibility study.

A risk retention group may not offer additional lines of liability insurance in this State or in another state until a revision of the plan of operation or feasibility study is approved by the Commissioner.
On receipt of the information required by subsection (c) of this section, the Commissioner shall forward the information to the National Association of Insurance Commissioners.
Providing notification to the National Association of Insurance Commissioners is in addition to and may not be sufficient to satisfy the other requirements of this subtitle.
